dt: {bc}to carry out fully {bc}put completely into effect
{bc}to do what is provided or required by
{bc}to put to death especially in compliance with a legal sentence
{bc}to make or produce (something, such as a work of art) especially by carrying out a design
{bc}to perform what is required to give validity to
{bc}to perform properly or skillfully the fundamentals of a sport or of a particular play
{bc}to perform indicated tasks according to encoded instructions
used of a computer program or routine

pt: {sc}kill{/sc} {sc}slay{/sc} {sc}murder{/sc} {sc}assassinate{/sc} {sc}dispatch{/sc} {sc}execute{/sc} mean to deprive of life. {sc}kill{/sc} merely states the fact of death caused by an agency in any manner.
{sc}slay{/sc} is a chiefly literary term implying deliberateness and violence but not necessarily motive.
{sc}murder{/sc} specifically implies stealth and motive and premeditation and therefore full moral responsibility.
{sc}assassinate{/sc} applies to deliberate killing openly or secretly often for political motives.
{sc}dispatch{/sc} stresses quickness and directness in putting to death.
{sc}execute{/sc} stresses putting to death as a legal penalty.

{sc}perform{/sc} {sc}execute{/sc} {sc}discharge{/sc} {sc}accomplish{/sc} {sc}achieve{/sc} {sc}effect{/sc} {sc}fulfill{/sc} mean to carry out or into effect. {sc}perform{/sc} implies action that follows established patterns or procedures or fulfills agreed-upon requirements and often connotes special skill.
{sc}execute{/sc} stresses the carrying out of what exists in plan or in intent.
{sc}discharge{/sc} implies execution and completion of appointed duties or tasks.
{sc}accomplish{/sc} stresses the successful completion of a process rather than the means of carrying it out.

pt.t: {it}accomplished{/it} everything they set out to do

pt: {sc}achieve{/sc} adds to {sc}accomplish{/sc} the implication of conquered difficulties.
{sc}effect{/sc} adds to {sc}achieve{/sc} an emphasis on the inherent force in the agent capable of surmounting obstacles.
{sc}fulfill{/sc} implies a complete realization of ends or possibilities.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}executer{/it}, from {it}execucion{/it} execution
shortdef: to carry out fully : put completely into effect
to do what is provided or required by
to put to death especially in compliance with a legal sentence
